patterns.description: Interface IP configuration entered in global configuration mode (e.g., 'ip address' or 'ipv6 address' under (config)#).

marker_check.description: Caret usually points at the start of 'ip' or 'ipv6' because the command is not valid in this mode.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is an interface-level command, but you are in global configuration mode. Interface addressing must be applied under the specific interface (config-if)#.

fix.template: Enter the interface first, then apply the address.

patterns.description: Line authentication commands ('password', 'login local') attempted in global configuration mode instead of line configuration mode.

marker_check.description: Caret points at the 'p' in 'password' or 'l' in 'login' because these are not valid in global config.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' configures line authentication, but you are in global configuration mode. Line authentication must be set under line configuration mode (config-line)#.

fix.template: Enter the line and then configure authentication.

patterns.description: Using 'clock set' outside of privileged EXEC or misspelling 'clock' (e.g., 'clok set') in configuration mode.

marker_check.description: Caret appears under 'clo...' because 'clock set' is not valid in configuration modes and/or 'clock' was misspelled.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' must be run in privileged EXEC mode (Router#), not configuration mode. Also ensure 'clock' is spelled correctly.

fix.template: Exit to privileged EXEC and run the correct syntax.

patterns.description: Student uses CIDR notation with IPv4 address (slash prefix) in 'ip address' instead of dotted-decimal subnet mask.

marker_check.description: Caret typically points to the '/' before the prefix length.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' uses CIDR notation. IOS IPv4 addressing on interfaces requires a dotted-decimal subnet mask, not '/{prefix}'.

fix.template: Provide a subnet mask in dotted-decimal format.

patterns.description: IPv6 address given with a space then prefix length (e.g., 'ipv6 address 2001:db8::1 64') instead of using '/'.

marker_check.description: Caret commonly appears at the prefix number because the parser expects '/'.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' has an IPv6 syntax issue. The prefix length must be attached to the address with '/'. You entered a space before '{prefix}'.

fix.template: Attach the prefix length directly to the address.

patterns.description: Hostname command misspelled or tokenized incorrectly (e.g., 'ostname' or 'host name').

marker_check.description: Caret points at the bad token 'ostname' or at 'name' after 'host'.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is not valid. IOS uses a single keyword 'hostname' (no space).

fix.template: Use the single keyword 'hostname'.

patterns.description: Incorrect syntax for enabling password encryption (missing hyphen or misspelled keyword).

marker_check.description: Caret indicates the unexpected tokenization or misspelling.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is malformed. IOS expects 'service password-encryption' (with a hyphen and 'password' spelled correctly).

fix.template: Use the exact command with the hyphen.

patterns.description: Interface command with misspelled interface type (e.g., 'interfase', 'gigabiteternet', 'Cerial').

marker_check.description: Caret points at the misspelled interface type.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' contains a misspelled interface type. Use the correct interface keyword (e.g., 'interface gigabitEthernet 0/0' or 'interface serial 0/0/0').

fix.template: Correct the interface keyword spelling.

patterns.description: Static route command misspelled as 'ip rute' instead of 'ip route'.

marker_check.description: Caret is under 'rute' because 'route' is expected.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is misspelled. Use 'ip route' to configure a static route.

fix.template: Correct the keyword and re-enter the route.

patterns.description: Misspelling 'configure terminal' as 'configure termimal'.

marker_check.description: Caret points into the misspelled word 'termimal'.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is misspelled. The correct command is 'configure terminal' to enter global configuration mode.

fix.template: Re-enter with the correct spelling.

patterns.description: Various misspellings of 'show' and its subcommands (e.g., 'sh rum', 'shou interfaces', 'show runing-config', 'show ip rute', 'show vercion').

marker_check.description: Caret appears under the misspelled token after 'show' (or under 'shou').

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' contains a misspelling in the 'show' command or its arguments.

fix.template: Use the correct 'show' command.

patterns.description: Unknown word at user EXEC prompts a name lookup (Translating ...) and ultimately fails.
signatures: Unknown command or computer name, or unable to find computer address

marker_check.description: No caret marker is used for this failure.

diagnosis.template: The input '{command}' is not a valid EXEC command. IOS attempted to resolve it as a hostname (name lookup), which failed.

fix.template: Check the command spelling or disable DNS lookup if unintended.

patterns.description: Misspellings in 'enable secret' command (e.g., 'emable secret', 'enabel secret', 'enable secet').

marker_check.description: Caret points at the misspelled keyword ('emable', 'enabel', or 'secet').

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is misspelled. Use 'enable secret <password>' to set the encrypted enable password.

fix.template: Re-enter with correct spelling.

patterns.description: Misspelling in 'banner motd' (e.g., 'baner motd', 'banner mtd').

marker_check.description: Caret points at 'baner' or 'mtd' due to misspelling.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is misspelled. Use 'banner motd <delim>message<delim>' (e.g., '#Hello#').

fix.template: Use the correct keywords and delimiters.

patterns.description: Misspelled line selectors (e.g., 'lime console', 'line conzole', 'line bty').

marker_check.description: Caret points at 'lime', 'conzole', or 'bty'.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is misspelled. Use 'line console 0' or 'line vty 0 4' to enter line configuration.

fix.template: Correct the line selector.

patterns.description: Common typos in interface subcommands (e.g., 'ip adress', 'ipv6 adress', 'desription', 'ezit').

marker_check.description: Caret appears under the misspelled token.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' contains a misspelling in interface configuration. Use the correct keyword spelling.

fix.template: Re-enter with correct spelling.

patterns.description: Typos within line configuration (e.g., 'pasword' instead of 'password', 'login lokal' instead of 'login local').

marker_check.description: Caret points at 'pasword' or 'lokal'.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is misspelled in line configuration mode.

fix.template: Correct the spelling.

patterns.description: Typos in 'transport input ssh' (e.g., 'trasport', 'imput').

marker_check.description: Caret points at the misspelled token 'trasport' or 'imput'.

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is misspelled. Use 'transport input ssh' to allow SSH on VTY lines.

fix.template: Use the exact command.

patterns.description: Catch-all for invalid commands in global configuration mode that don't match specific patterns.

marker_check.description: Generic catch-all

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is not valid in global configuration mode. Check the spelling and syntax.

fix.template: Verify the correct command syntax for global configuration mode.

patterns.description: Catch-all for invalid commands in interface configuration mode that don't match specific patterns.

marker_check.description: Generic catch-all

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is not valid in interface configuration mode. Check the spelling and syntax.

fix.template: Verify the correct command syntax for interface configuration mode.

patterns.description: Catch-all for invalid commands in line configuration mode that don't match specific patterns.

marker_check.description: Generic catch-all

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is not valid in line configuration mode. Check the spelling and syntax.

fix.template: Verify the correct command syntax for line configuration mode.

patterns.description: Catch-all for invalid commands in privileged exec mode that don't match specific patterns.

marker_check.description: Generic catch-all

diagnosis.template: The command '{command}' is not recognized. Check the spelling and syntax.

fix.template: Verify the correct command syntax.
